info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 8:34PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Union NC. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 825 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated torrential rain due to thunderstorms moving across northeastern Union County. Isolated rain gauges have reported 2-3 inches of rainfall in about an hour. This rainfall is likely to cause excessive runoff and nuisance to Minor flooding may be imminent in the Advisory area. The area of greatest concern is along Richardson Creek and associated tributaries north of Fairfield from New Salem to Olive Branch. This includes areas near the Eagle Chase Golf Club, including near Olive Branch Rd, Ansonville Rd, NC 205, Pleasant Grove Church Rd, and NC 218. Please exercise caution on area roadways and avoid low-lying areas adjacent to area streams for the next few hours. Additional heavy rainfall is developing across southeastern Union County. This heavy rainfall may move into the Advisory area and may exacerbate ongoing flood concerns. A Flash Flood Warning may be needed if additional heavy rainfall develops. Please stay weather aware and be prepared to seek higher ground if you are in an area vulnerable to flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Unionville, Marshville, and New Salem. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
